ACL_CLEAR_FLAGS_NP(3) Library Functions Manual ACL_CLEAR_FLAGS_NP(3)

NAME

acl_clear_flags_np —
clear flags from a flag set

LIBRARY

Standard C Library (libc, -lc)

SYNOPSIS

#include <sys/types.h>
#include <sys/acl.h>

int
acl_clear_flags_np(acl_flagset_t flagset_d);

DESCRIPTION

The acl_clear_flags_np() function is a nonstandard extension that clears all flags from flag set flagset_d.

RETURN VALUES

The acl_clear_flags_np() function returns the value 0 if successful; otherwise the value -1 is returned and the global variable errno is set to indicate the error.

ERRORS

The acl_clear_flags_np() function fails if:
[EINVAL]
Argument flagset_d is not a valid descriptor for a flag set.

SEE ALSO

acl(3), acl_add_flag_np(3), acl_delete_flag_np(3), acl_get_flagset_np(3), acl_set_flagset_np(3)
